notes:
Total tests are taken from the annotations on the charts on the page. 
Negatives = (Totals – Positives)
Positives occasionally update before totals do; do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
Last Updated (Local Time) = (todays date + time = 00:00)
name: Alaska

notes:
Negatives = (Totals - Positives) 
Positives occasionally update before totals do; do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
Last Updated (Local Time) = (current date + time = 00:00)
name: Alabama

notes: [4/18 - Cumulative Hospitalized, Cumulative On Ventilator](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=90WD3LWo5R0)
name: Arkansas

notes:
American Samoa has no testing facilities and must send samples from all suspected cases to faraway labs, which means that test results can take over a week to come back. There is therefore very little information about testing on its official pages. Our information about testing of American Samoan residents comes from [a news source from 3/31](https://www.samoanews.com/local-news/out-5-suspected-coronavirus-samples-3-test-negative-so-far) and [a news source from 4/6](https://www.samoanews.com/local-news/no-confirmed-coronavirus-cases-identified-american-samoa).

Our historical data for American Samoa has been inaccurate. We have addressed the issue.
name: American Samoa

notes:
Dashboard now has a new tab that details total tested. 
Negative = Total - Positive
We do not currently track it, but hospitalization and ICU data is available from [Maricopa County](https://www.maricopa.gov/5460/Coronavirus-Disease-2019) and [Pima County](https://webcms.pima.gov/cms/One.aspx?portalId=169&pageId=527452)
name: Arizona

notes: The state has been inconsistent in its timing of reporting, so we used faster updating sources until 4/1, when we standardized on [California's new data dashboards](https://public.tableau.com/views/COVID-19PublicDashboard/Covid-19Public?:embed=y&:display_count=no&:showVizHome=no). This led to a drop in cases and deaths, as the state's data lags some other sources. We assume that "tests conducted" = "people tested." The state also reported a huge batch of negative tests 4/4. Negative, pending, and total test reporting tend to lag positive test reporting by one day.
name: California

notes:
Negative = People Tested - Cases. Cases include people who test positive for COVID-19 AND people who have symptoms of COVID-19 and are a close contact to someone who tested positive. 
Data is updated daily by about 4 p.m. and includes cases reported through the previous day.
name: Colorado

notes:
Negative = Total - Positive.  
Positives occasionally update before totals do; we do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
name: Connecticut

notes: Positive and Negative include both public and commercial labs.
name: District Of Columbia

notes:
We report using the raw data provided by FDOH.
On 3/26 their dashboard stopped including non-residents in its visible counts, but they still track them behind the scenes.  
On 3/21 negatives jumped due to change in methodology: they began including tests of people not investigated as PUIs.
name: Florida

notes:
Positive includes deaths. Positives occasionally update before totals do; we do not revise negatives down, keep the last calculated negative.
The page includes a "report generated" time at the bottom of the page and a data "as of" time. We use the "as of" time a the top of the page as our Update Time.
name: Georgia

notes: Guam's total reported cases include 11 people tested at the Naval base in San Diego. Their statistics are reported daily or several times per day by press release and the Governor's Facebook page.
name: Guam

notes:
Data now pulled from dashboard. [New Dashboard Project](https://www.hawaiidata.org/covid19)
Positives = Positive tests
name: Hawaii

notes: If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00. Not all commercial labs report negatives to Iowa, as per their guidance.
name: Iowa

notes: Total includes Oregon residents tested in Idaho, as the state does in its table (noted below).  Negatives = Totals - Positives. Positives sometimes update before totals do; when this happens, we keep the last calculated negative.
name: Idaho

notes: Illinois counts deaths in positives.
name: Illinois

notes: Negative = Total – Positive. Totals are incomplete for private labs, so negatives are a lower bound.
name: Indiana

notes:
Negative = Total - Positive.
Positives sometimes update before totals do; when this happens, we keep the last calculated negative. [4/11 - Currently Hospitalized, Cumulative Hospitalized, Currently in ICU, Cumulative in ICU, Recovered](https://www.whas11.com/article/news/health/coronavirus/kentucky-covid-19-updates/417-db76b6c6-185b-4e72-9c41-331d043b6d63)
name: Kentucky

notes: Total Tests = State Lab + Commercial Lab, Negative = Total Tests - Positive
name: Louisiana

notes: Positives include results from the CDC. Total tested includes repeat testing on individuals. State lab numbers are as of 8 am, other lab numbers are as of 11:30 am. Commercial lab numbers are subject to change.
name: Massachusetts

notes: Didn't report negatives between 3/12 and 3/28.
name: Maryland

notes:
State does not report totals or negatives, last report was: 3/30
Use the time at the top row of the table.
name: Maine

notes: Since 3/23, Negative = Total - Positive.
name: Minnesota

notes: Negative = Total - Positive
name: Missouri

notes: Mariana Islands.
name: Northern Mariana Islands

notes:
Negatives = Total tested - Positives
Hospitalizations are calculated by calculating multiplying % of hospitalized times total cases, pending clarification from the state.
name: Mississippi

notes: Negative = Total - Positive.  The dashboard says that the data "as-of" is from the day previous - in this case we use current date + time stamp of 0:00
name: Montana

notes: Negative = Total tests* - total positives (where total tests include all data from public labs and partial data from hospital and commercial labs).
name: North Carolina

notes: As of 3/30, numbers reflect both public and private lab results.
name: North Dakota

notes:
If no timestamp was given, time = 00:00
We do not currently track it, but hospitalization data are available from [Douglas County](https://dogis.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/21bec056a9a6449abcca89a329868fd6)
name: Nebraska

notes: Negative count is from the four largest labs. Pending count is from the Public Health Laboratories only.
name: New Hampshire

notes: Positive count includes deaths. Hospitalization + ICU counts include both positive cases and persons under investigation.
name: New Jersey

notes: [Hospitalization from NMDH](https://cv.nmhealth.org/newsroom/) *Hospitalization number may include individuals who tested positive for COVID-19 out of state but are currently hospitalized in New Mexico. This number does not include New Mexicans who tested positive for COVID-19 and may have been transferred to a hospital out of state.
name: New Mexico

notes: Individual data fields have different update times; we use the latest time as our "Last Update" time. NV is one of the rare states to distinguish # of people tested from # of samples tested.
name: Nevada

notes:
Numbers come from [press conference](https://www.governor.ny.gov). 
We are using discharged numbers as recovered
name: New York

notes: Ohio now publishes detailed [Key Metrics](https://coronavirus.ohio.gov/wps/portal/gov/covid-19/dashboards/key-metrics/cases)
name: Ohio

notes:
[Executive Order Detailed Reporting](https://coronavirus.health.ok.gov/executive-order-reports)
First reported [comprehensive test results] https://coronavirus.health.ok.gov/articles/new-data-private-labs-show-tenfold-increase-covid-19-tests-administered-oklahoma-dating on 4/6. We exclude "Positive (Out-of-State)" results as we assume these individuals are isolated outside the state. Last Update time based on the "As of" time below the charts.
name: Oklahoma

notes: Total includes Oregon & Montana residents tested in Idaho, as the state does in its table (noted below).
name: Oregon

notes: County level data doesn't add up to the totals provided. We are not adding deaths back into positives.
name: Pennsylvania

notes:
Deaths include confirmed and presumed COVID deaths.
Puerto Rico reports positive, negative, pending, and inconclusive results. We have added the inconclusive results to the pending results.
Tests refer to specimens, not people http://periodismoinvestigativo.com/2020/04/las-matematicas-de-salud-estan-mal/
name: Puerto Rico

notes: Recovered numbers are from hospital discharges.
name: Rhode Island

notes: SC now reports negative from both private and public labs. Hospitalization data carried over from weekly 3/25 presentation.
name: South Carolina

notes: Tennessee now provides positive and negative test results from all laboratories. On 4/5, the state reported a decline in recoveries.
name: Tennessee

notes: We are assuming Texas is reporting only completed testing, pending further guidance, which we are seeking from the state.
name: Texas

notes: Positive count includes non-Utah residents. Negative = Total - Positive. Negative test results may lag for up to 72 hours, according to the state.
name: Utah

notes: VA hospitalization statistics from [Hospital dashboard](https://www.vhha.com/communications/virginia-hospital-covid-19-data-dashboard/)  We assume that the number of people "hospitalized in the ICU" includes the number of people "currently on a ventilator."
name: Virginia

notes: Virgin Islands: Positive, Negative, and Pending provided.
name: US Virgin Islands

notes: Negative = (Total Tested - Positives). VT reports both Currently Hospitalized (implicitly, confirmed cases only) and Hospitalized Under Investigation. For Currently Hospitalized, we sum these two numbers.
name: Vermont

notes:
WA reports confirmed cases, laboratory tests, and deaths as of the previous day. WA did not report new negative test results between 3/31/2020 and 4/15/2020.
4/19: Total cases reported today (4/19/20) are lower than yesterday. Data cleaning that occurred late on 4/18 removed 190 confirmed cases that were discovered to be out of state residents.
name: Washington

notes:
The number of people with negative test results includes only Wisconsin residents who had negative test results reported electronically to DHS. As a result, this number underestimates the total number of Wisconsin residents with negative test results. 
As individual cases are investigated by public health, there may be corrections to the status and details of cases that result in changes to this information.
Deaths must be reported by health care providers, medical examiners/coroners, and recorded by local health departments in order to be counted.
name: Wisconsin

notes: Negatives = Totals - Positives. As of 4/16 WV is reporting hospitalization + icu + ventilator counts from 49 of 55 counties. Before 4/16, those counts were unreliable -- based on reported percentages of completed investigations, an unpublished number.
name: West Virginia

notes:
Negatives = Total - Positive.
The week of 4/6, WY began separating confirmed & suspected cases. We now report only confirmed. From 4/7 to 4/13, our recovered count may be slightly high, as WY combined recovered confirmed cases + recovered probable cases.
[4/15 - Cumulative Hospitalized](https://www.wyomingnewsnow.tv/content/news/2nd-Covid-19-related-death-in-Wyoming-confirmed-569660141.html)
name: Wyoming
